intro: Lindsaea trapezoidea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lindsaea, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, elongated fronds that are typically divided into narrow, linear segments. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called sori, which are clustered on the underside of the fronds. Native to tropical regions of Central and South America, it thrives in shaded, moist environments. Its unique morphology makes it a subject of interest in both botanical research and horticultural cultivation.
